Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Nick_VTRESORT
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife in March 2011. The guy at the front desk hates his job and lets you know that. We were travelling on to South America and had no printout of our connecting flight information. We were forced to use the antique computer in the lobby (and pay for that!) just to print out what we had showed him on our phone before. He then copied some data from that printout into his computer instead of copying it from the screen, which would have been MUCH faster and cheaper for us. We then found out that they had scr**** up our reservation and that there was no room with a double bed left. After almost TWO HOURS we ended up in a smelly, tiny room with a metal double story bed like those at army camps (or prison). The next day we were given a room with a double bed, and that was just it: a room with a double bed, NOTHING else. The cleanlyness of the place was OK for a hostel, but just about everything else was simply terrible. It's a two minute walk to the sub, so the location is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sarah l
Reviews.Content: I would never ever say in this hostel again. It was awful. We paid more money for 3 days than is realistic for a NYC hostel and when we got into the room it had a bunk bed and NOTHING ELSE> awful. When I went to complain, the manager was unavaliable, and they would not return the money.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the draw, could be good or terrible!”
Reviews.Author: 03begra
Reviews.Content: Me and my traveling buddy booked the hostel through a travel agent, our only requests were that we did share a room with others. The room was very basic, a bunk bed and a bin. The sheets on the bed were not thick at all, requested more and was handed two moth eaten blankets. We decided not to use these as we had read reviews on here about bed bugs so didn't want to introduce any insects to our seemingly beg bug free beds. Instead slept in jumper and trousers. Common areas not a good a ones we had in LA (pool table, bar etc missing) and this meant meeting other travelers was not the easiest. (but when you are in NY there are plenty of other things to do. Lots of people complaining of noisy pipes, bed bugs, cockroaches, filth and grime etc. We did not see much of these things. But in the bathroom the pipes were banging loudly and I'm sure some rooms have bed bugs. I could see this hostel potentially being a nightmare for some travelers, but luckily for us it was adequate and we were fine! I wouldnt stay there again because it's just too unpredictable what your stay will be like, but if you don't mind roughing it out. This place is cheap and in a good spot!

Reviews.Title: “Chocolat Hostel @ Upper East Side is ideal if you are on a tight budget and don't want to share a room”
Reviews.Author: Pam655
Reviews.Content: Before I checked in I read every review here on Trip Advisor. I honestly was scared to find a dirty room and bathroom with... bed bugs! I expected a terrible stay. However, I was surprised to find a neat and clean individual room with a clean shared bathroom. I recommend it for its perfect location and affordable price. I don't recommend it in Winter (cold cold room) unless you take your own bed covers but the shower was perfect though. It's true that the staff is not friendly at all. There is a big TV and there are electronic lockers downstairs!! Wifi is good and if you don't have a laptop there are computers available (you have to pay though).

Reviews.Title: “A great hostel for young traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: george9595
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hostel hours before check-in time, and I was able to put my bags in a locker and check my email at one of the lobby computers, and then it was a quick walk around the block to the subway. When it came time to check-in, the front desk was friendly and quick, although they had some trouble with their English. My room was a typical hostel room--small, basic, yet adequate. I'd recommend bringing a pillowcase if possible. The other travelers in the hostel left their washclothes and loofahs in the communal showers--gross!! All in all, I was very happy with this hostel and it was better than hostels I've stayed at in London, Paris, Rome, Florence and Munich. It was so much fun coming back after a night at the bars at 3am to find the lobby packed with visitors from all over the world getting to know each other.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: ceLaVieee
Reviews.Content: We were staying there for 9 days because it was cheap! And we did not dislike it! The staff was horrible, they didn´t even look you in the eyes when you were talking to them. the rooms wasn´t that good but you get what you pay for! The locaion was really great, close to the subway, close to a nice mexican restaurant and a couple of blocks to central park. If you don´t have high standards it´s not that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hostel - get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: HollyxS
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hostel and was told nothing. The girl on the desk was really unfriendly. Told me my room was on the 2nd floor and nothing else. Didn't tell me about the TV room in the basement - took me two days to find out it was there. Got to my room and it was a smallish room with one bunk bed, a mirror and a tiny table. The bed was made up and the room was warm. Met my room-mate, she was lovely. Felt really safe leaving my bag in my room. When I finally found the TV room, got chatting to some really lovely people. There's also a laundry room, computers with internet, lockers and vending machines in the basement. The hostel is really close to the subway which takes you into the heart of Manhattan. It's also really close to the Hudson river and Central Park. It's also a block down from Metro Diner, where they serve AMAZING pancakes!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this creepy place...”
Reviews.Author: gillygrl48
Reviews.Content: The Romanian guy at the front desk was incredibly rude, the rooms filthy and roaches running freely. Bathrooms were smelly and filthy as well. Stay away from this creepy dive. They prey on foreigners who are vulnerable.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Lysol Dysinfectant, but not in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: MoniHoss
Reviews.Content: You should know what you are in for if you make a reservation at a hostel. Don't expect fancy shmancy. Don't expect clean. Don't expect red carpets. Chocotat's location can't be beat and for the price this is the place to stay. Workers are friendly enough and somewhat helpful. Place is in need of a SUPER cleaning; doesn't seem that carpet had been vaccumed in months, maybe even more than a year. Bring your own sleeping bag; the bed linens are pretty gross. Most other guests are international and don't speak much english. I went with my mom (in her 50's) and sister (20's) and we all agreed this was a gross place, but the location was worth the money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Chocolat Hostel and all I got was CRABS!!!”
Reviews.Author: ljkamler
Reviews.Content: First off...I booked this room on hotels.com (incredibly crappy organization) for about $100. When I saw the room, I about s*at myself. I wasn't expecting much, but yes, this was nothing like what was depicted on the hotels.com website. No TV, no furniture, no towels...just a rickety metal bunk bed with a pad that was supposed to be a mattress and sheets that were like sheets of paper. Free wi-fi? What wi-fi? There was so much hair in the shared bath tub, it looked as if someone had tried to force a cat down the drain. Thank god I was only there one night. It seemed that the majority of other guests were foreigners that were vacationing/exploring NYC...probably had no idea what they were signing up for when they booked their rooms. I wasn't looking for luxury accomodation by any means, but when you depict your rooms as being a certain way and charge $100 for it, I expect a $100 room. I'd say these rooms were worth $30 a night tops. In fact, I found another website that listed the rate at $30 or $40 a night at the Chocolat. Of course, when I tried to enforce hotels.com price match guarantee, I never heard from them. If you stay here, I'd book directly and haggle with the front desk over price. Also, wear a condom or dental dam at all times unless you want to spend the extra money on an STD test when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: Italy201134
Reviews.Content: Having never been to prison-I hope that my stay at Chocolat Hostel is as close as I ever get. The room -a single, included a medal bunk bed, had a bare light bulb on the ceiling and NOTHING else in the room. The bath was down the hall-forget about clean, I never risked taking a shower-the tub had at least one inch of mold. Upon arriving I asked for another room and was shown the same layout with the addition of a toilet in the corner..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Hostel Chocolat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maxine_Rhea09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week in October with my friend, who stayed in the hostel in May 2010, so the hostel was recommended initially by her. We had no problems checking in, the room was basic, but it had a bed and there were bathroom facilities so that's all I cared about. I found the bed very comfortable, temperature in the room was sometimes a little chilly but I just put more layers on, as I would any where if I was cold. Internet was reasonably priced, 20 mins for $2. Reception always had change, I'm sure my friend and I were constantly bugging them, but they were all really friendly. Veer was really helpful and friendly, he gave my friend and I a map and highlighted the best shopping areas! Very important for 2 girls! Most times I was in reception (usually bugging the staff) I also got talking to other people staying in the hostel, everyone seemed social and nice. The bathrooms were always clean, apart from one day although it was cleaned within an hour, so the cleaners are spot on. The bathroom next to our room developed a leak from the bathroom on the floor above, and this was fixed within 12 hours. People coming back from nights out/trips could be noisy along the coridoors but I brought ear plugs knowing I'm a light sleeper. That's hardly the fault of the hostel anyway! My friend and I are about to book for another week in the new year at this hostel. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Id rather have gonorrhea than stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nrice07
Reviews.Content: Dirty and always smelled like pot. Employee was rude and dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “bear and forbear”
Reviews.Author: DanielaKarin
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because it was the cheapest place to find in such a good location here in NY, and after one week this is the one & only positive aspect to mention about the hostel! A lot of strange things seemed to go on there, such as overbooking, bedbucks and weird odors. We were just glad that we had no insects in our room and that the weird smells stayed outside on the corridor. Most of the time we found the bathrooms clean and our room provided with fresh bedlinen, unless they forgot new towels twice. There was nothing in the room, except the bed and so it felt very gloomy and uncomfortable. The heating pipe made a terrible noise at night - We thought someone is running up and down the firestairs outside or that we might have an animal in the pipe in our room. This was very disturbing and I wonder how we were able to sleep at all. I found this place a bad jocke - It has nothing to do with the standarts we know from European hostels and it does not fit the description on there official homepage at all. I can just recomend to avoid places like this and tell everyone about it - Such places need to be shut down. Asap.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!”
Reviews.Author: branci
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this place got any licence as a hotel. I am very tolerant, that's why I went there, even after I saw reviews. And besides there is only bed in a room (very uncomfortable), tv that doesn't work and shared bathroom, there is even bigger problem: HEATING PIPES ARE MAKING SUCH A NOISE ON EVERY 1HR THAT IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO SLEEP. YOU WAKE UP EVERY TIME, SO THIS IS NOT EVEN PLACE FOR SLEEP OVER. IT SOUNDS LIKE SOMEBODY IN YOUR ROOM IS HITTING THEM WITH METAL BAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great city!”
Reviews.Author: blackcatsoup
Reviews.Content: READ: This is a HOSTEL people! Not a boutique hotel, not a luxury resort, but a hostel. Who goes to New York City to hang out in their hotel room all day/night? We went there to explore the city and then have a CHEAP place to crash, and that is exactly what we did/got. This hostel is cheap and in a fantastic location (1-2 blocks away from the 1 subway.) The bathrooms are small, the room is small, the windows don't open, and the pictures are hilariously wrong, but WHO CARES?! We just wore flip-flops in the shower and checked for bed bugs. Anyone who complained after spending $79 a night in NYC needs to take the stick out of their @$$es.

Reviews.Title: “A nice cheap place to stay - does not deserve the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Conyers23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months back... the reviews on here got me quite worried, but I don't think this place deserves half of what ahs been written about it on Trip Advisor! Qualifiers: I stayed on my own in a private room and didn't make much use of the facilities, so I can't comment on those. What I got here was perfectly servicable, clean accomodation, on a budget, in an excellent location for NY city. Yes, it is slightly shabby and lacking in ammenities, but if all you want is a cheap, clean bed for the night and easy access to all New York has to offer, you won't go wrong staying here. If you're thinking about staying and worried about other reviews, look at the dates of the really bad ones - the ones that mention bed bugs etc. are all from years ago, and it was obvious to me when I stayed that they had cleaned and rennovated since then! If I go back to NY on my own I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sums up new york for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerUK
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking for budget accomodation is likely to be tempted with this place, in most other cities the price paid here would guarantee something really good, but in new york all accomodation is overpriced. Some general points to note: 1) the location is really nice, a few blocks from central park , in a nice neighbourhood - probably the main plus point, plus the fact the subway is one block away. 2) By Boutique Hostel , what they mean is that they have painted the walls brown and used ikea lighting. the place is very shabby 3) The bathrooms were spotless which is a minor miracle given the size of some of them and the number of guests staying 4) sadly i was bitten all over my body from something in the bed, whether it be bed bugs or fleas. when one of my friends saw the state of my arms and neck they offered me their sofa as they were horrified i had come to their city and got this. not like you can blame mosquitos in october (it was cold) 5) Internet is pay as you go, and the staff are direct and wont go beyond themselves to help you. Dont expect pro active service/ They were pleasant enough in their own style. 6) Everytime i sat at the internet the person next to me was using search engines to try and find alternative accomodation and i saw two people say they were leaving early to stay elsewhere. Problem is, most hotels are extortionate, hence why i stuck it out (beer helped). 7)if you book via hostelworld , just be aware that you will pay more than quoted, on arrival thanks to local tax, so bring extra to what it says on your confirmation If you stay here make sure you get drunk every evening and bring towels to lay over the bed

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AnnaStilton
Reviews.Content: The photos are fake! The rooms lack everything but the bed, there are holes in the floor under the carpet, the towels are the size of a tissue, it's noisy, it smells weird and it's not even the cheapest hotel you can find. The bathrooms (size of a closet) where kept clean however and the location is good, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE, THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY BUT WON'T GIVE YOU A ROOM!!”
Reviews.Author: Special-treats
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends booked to go to a festival in New York over the Labor Day weekend, Septmber 2010. We wanted to go round the city and see as much as possible and do as much as we could so we didn't want to spend a ot of money on a place to stay. We looked at several hostels in New York and a lot of the places didn't have enough room for the amount of people we had, then we came across Chocolat Hostel, the website showed the hostel to look nice, pretty basic but it was only cheap so it was perfect for what we wanted. We contacted the hostel to make sure they had availability, the woman we spoke to on the phone said they had a room available but the only way to book was online, which is what we did. Everything was confirmed, a confirmation email was sent to my hotmail account and the deposit was taken from my bank account. The day we were checking into the hostel, we arrived, the woman took my name and confirmation number and told us that there was no reservation and nothing had been booked. After she told us that she just stopped laking and it looked like she expected us to just walk away. We obviously asked what we were meant to do and what had happened, she then told us several different stories such as, the system broke down when we booked so nothing was finalised, she then said that there was a problem a few days before our check in date and my money had been refunded and I was sent an email to tell me that the reservation had been cancelled. She didn't know what to say to us, so we asked for the manager, to which she replied "He is on vacation for 3 weeks" we then said we wanted to speak to someone else then because she wasn't helping at all, she replied, "trust me, no one cares". We were all disgusted at the way she spoke to us and how she handled the situation. The whole thing was a nightmare and the woman that worked at the hostel was so rude that she upset us all. Luckily, there was a hostel a few blocks down called "Sky Hostel" that had just enough room available for us. The guy that dealt with us was very helpful and managed to calm us all down after being so rudely spoken to at Chocolat. The Sky Hostel was the same price, the rooms are very basic but the staff were lovely and very friendly. DO NOT STAY AT CHOCOLAT HOSTEL, SPEND A LITTLE MORE MONEY AND GET SOMETHING DECENT. I cannot stress enough...DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: 8BallDude
Reviews.Content: What a waste of money this place is. The front desk staff are useless, they were all too busy on Facebook and online shopping to help paying customers. They were rude, unfriendly and had no real knowledge about the hostel and it's facilities. It really anooid everyone staying here, they really didn't care about the guests. Do not be fooled, despite offering the following facilities there is NO TV is the guest rooms, no launderette, no restaurant, no WiFi in rooms and Air Conditioning in a majority of the rooms (and believe me in August NYC is HOT and muggy! You need Air Con). The rooms are very basic and have been renovated to a pretty low standard. The room we stayed in was half finished, the paint job was shoddy and our quilt was from the 70s, clumpy, itchy and stained with DRIED BLOOD!. Not nice. This is all coming from a "recently renovated hostel". The beds had bedbugs, I was bitten all over! The sink in the room was hanging off the wall fixtures, in some places they had painted over cracked walls and dust. The one redeeming factor of the hostel is the basement lounge, it has TV, Internet and comfy sofas, however this isn't good enough to make up for all the bad. The bathrooms were dirty, cramped and were very tired. Overall this hostel is worth staying away from. We spoke to other people staying here and they too agree. Seriously consider whether you want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: Tinekav
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a hostel before, or in any accomodation actually since i was 12 and thought the hostel was fine, i actually book for somewhere else which closed so i ended up getting 3 nights for 27 bucks because they screwed up when i book and my deposit didn't go through but they still emailed me to tell me i had a room here instead of the other place so i was like oh well and they didn't let me pay the deposit there so i was stoked about that, I thought it was clean and warm and my bunk was actually really comfy, the staff were a tad rude but maybe thats cause i only payed 27bucks and i met a couple of cool people so yeah i thought it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CrystalB4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 3 different hostels in NYC. This was the nicest one we found. The rooms are very basic and simple like every other hostel. It is located in a nice area and near public transportation. If you are traveling to NYC on a budget and just need a place to shower and sleep then this is the place. If you want anything more book a hotel. The elevator is a little scary...Take the stairs. They have Internet and phones in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: keharris86
Reviews.Content: This was the first hostel I had ever stayed in so I wasn't sure what to expect but I knew not to expect much! I thought the building was beautiful and I really liked the location... it was close to a subway station and close to stores and felt safe and all. The room was basic just a bed and mirror and the tv didnt work (but we werent there to watch tv!) It was def. cheap, as my friend and I were on a tight budget, especially for the location with it being on the upper west side. They had an elevator which was nice (I had just had knee surgery!) We used the lockers they have downstairs to hold our stuff the day we checked out because we had to be out early but our flight wasn't until later so that was nice to leave our luggage there and not carry it with us but we had to pay for the lockers which I guess is typical. Id say it was ok and reccomend it to travelers on a budget, I was just excited to be in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “They steal your money”
Reviews.Author: chiquitacasey22
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here because after I made reservations I cancelled them and they charge 20 dollars to make a reservation and do not refund your money. The hostel has terrible customer service. They should get audited and shut down for being so disgusing.

Reviews.Title: “Aids Walk 2010”
Reviews.Author: Princessnoi
Reviews.Content: Stayed from May 14th to the 16th of May. The front desk clerk did not tell me my roommate was there, the hallways were dark, the elevator very slow and opened by pulling the door from the outside to get it, the door to my room squeaked, the one toliet backed up with poo, there was a tv in the room that did not work, and the window in the other bathroom would not close. It was sad to say but I got what I paid for, for $28.00. Would I recommend it, not to single females traveling alone. Guys probably would not mind. Plus if you are on a budget do not compromise your safety for being cheap.

Reviews.Title: “You're better off sleeping on the street!”
Reviews.Author: xpthompsonx
Reviews.Content: There was nothing in the hotel description about a bathroom with toilet overflow on the floor, fecal mater in the sink and in the bathtub/shower. I could've stayed under a tarp in the Park and felt cleaner. I understand what a hotel/hostel experience is like, as I've stayed at hundreds before, but this was absolute garbage and they should be arrested for charging more than $5. When I checked in they asked me what time I wanted to be woken up. I told them 9 am. They forgot. I missed my interview.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: Designez
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind dodgy doors, bed bugs, broken heating, shared & dirty bathrooms, non-working TVs and in general the most misrable hostel I have ever seen, than this is the perfect place for you, the budget traveller. I thought I wouldn't mind a little bit of discomfort in exchange for a low price, but this is just ridiculous. Please see my pictures and you know what I mean... Just pay a couple of dollars extra to have a more descent hostel. This one should be avoided if you want a descent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “There is no word to fully capture how BAD this place is!”
Reviews.Author: aash23
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this place is beyond any living human conception of NASTY. It was so so so bad, that after paying for a full week (which was foolish on our part), we paid for another hotel and wrote our £££ as a very bad experience. I was sat on the PC in the lobby, funnily enough looking for alternative accomodation, when the guy behind reception had a major arguement with someone. This resulted in a perspex advertisement stand on reception being thrown and missing my head by inches. The rooms were so bad, I cannot begin to explain. The lock on the door operated using electrical tape, which could be opened with a push of the hand. We tried to keep the costs down by booking this hotel, but I guess the moto "you get what you pay for" really rings true with this absolute dump. I note that the hotel has changed names, previously West End Studios, I am wondering if the name change is a pathetic attempt to rid the hotel of the archived TERRIBLE reviews on Tripadvisor. Good old Tripadvisor, I say well done for allowing the general public to realise NOT to book places like this.

Reviews.Title: “The Door Wouldn't Open”
Reviews.Author: legbullet996
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the Chocolat Hostel, you are greeted with such a nice check in area. The lady at the front desk was nice enough and asked "Do you want to see the room?" my response to her was "it has a bed right?" and she said yes but some people are expecting an upscale hotel. I wasn't. However the images on hostelworld.com and other sites are a bit misleading. They might have one or two rooms that look like the actual picture. I said in a double bed private shared bathroom. The hall and room was carpeted with indoor/outdoor carpeting that is brown. The bed was hard and the sheets thin. I was slightly concerned but the room was really hot and dry so I ended up kicking the covers off of myself. There was a TV but it was stuck on channel 33 and I it was all snow. There was a sink in the room but no mirror. There also was no garbage can. The closet had 3 hangers. The walls have been painted multiple times white and even painted over the electrical outlets. There was one wall painted brown. The shared bathroom was clean except for a few short and curleys. The shower was extremely hot and was like lasers hitting my skin. It was cheap and I would stay there again if every hostel in NYC was taken but I think I would try another one if I could next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad !”
Reviews.Author: BESTOFBERKS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Hostel chocolat and we kind of dreaded our stay there after all the bad and sometimes alarming reviews on this hostel. The truth is you really get what you pay for. We stayed for 10 days and paid around 700 $... Not much for Xmas time. Let's start with the positive : We thought the location was excellent, upper west side is great and the subway is a two minutes walk, loads of cafes , restaurants around. The hotel in itself is ok. The bedsheets are clean but they do look a bit dodgy. The heating is on full so be sure you will not be cold but it made such noise it woke me up at night. It was actually very very warm in the room. The staff , very friendly especially the cleaning staff if you speak Spanish. My advice would be to pack your flip flop for the shower room and pack also a light sleeping bag that you can use for the bed. Our aim was to spend little money on accomodation and do loads of shopping ! You still get a decent place to spend the night and you are only 25 minutes away by subway to Times Square On a budget ? This hotel is still a good investment to me.

Reviews.Title: “No frills accommodation; don't expect much for your money”
Reviews.Author: lachbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on our first visit to NYC. First things first- this is not a hotel; it is a hostel. We booked a private room with shared facilities . . . the room is a room but nothing else. It had a bed which needs a new mattress. There was a sink in the room which seemed to be coming away from the wall (!) but it worked. There is a TV but it didn't work and an extension lead which was useful for charging things. We stayed on the fourth floor; on arrival we got the elevator up but it kept stopping between floors so we got off at 3 and walked the stairs instead for the remainder of our stay! The shared bathroom was just along the corridor. Small and clean. In reception there is internet access ($2 for 20 minutes) and pay phones which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: Diederick
Reviews.Content: Room The room we had was not bad, there was a new bed, the tv was working and a window could be opened, however there was no table or anythign else to put our stuff on. facilities The toilets and showers were not that nice. They were either out of order or dirty. Some mornings I had to go down 3 floors to find a bathroom that was available and working. Location The location of the ho(s)tel is nice, its only 2 blocks from the 103rd street station and there are some shops and atm's nearby. Staff Friendly most of the time. If you only need a safe and fairly cheap bed to sleep in this ho(s)tel will do, but if you plan to spend more time at your hotel than find something else because you wont like what you find

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first... Chocolat should be your last resort!”
Reviews.Author: showmanNewYork
Reviews.Content: Yes the price is low... but really the interior of this place is disgusting. It's true what one traveler says about the pictures... they are not like reality! (See my horror story below) WHAT'S BAD: Unfinished basement with a messy "lounge" (nice flat screen TV though), dirty - shared - bathrooms, walls doors and windows are old and dirty. (Scroll a little further down for my horror story) WHAT'S GOOD: Location is in Manhattan but actually pretty quiet surroundings. Close to the 1 train on red line, close to the upper part of Central Park. My bad experience was the morning after our second night when I had asked to have our linens changed (a service you must request)... luckily we locked our bags and valuables in the storage lockers because when we returned at 9pm on Friday night we were amazed to see that they removed everything from our room. They took our jackets, sneakers, a couple of brand new books, hair products, toothbrushes and shampoo. We went down to the front desk (nice French guy named Thomas) and he called the housekeeping supervisor who called the actual housekeeper and long story short... they threw EVERYTHING in the garbage except for our jackets. It was unbelievable, and a real lack of logic on the housekeeper's part. How do you throw away sneakers but keep jackets? No compensation was offered for our loss. My suggestion is that you stay away from this place... try other hostels. If you do end up staying here then don't take any housekeeping service and lock up your belongings in the lockers in the basement. Please note that I am honestly rating this place as a hostel and not as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too expansive for what they offer. Great Pictures in comparison to reality.”
Reviews.Author: BrazilPaulista
Reviews.Content: We found some used left over underwear below the bed... it was dam nasty!! Lots of bugs, bathrooms were always "out of service" and to top it off: when we got there we were told there was an additional $15 per day we had to pay. "hidden fees" from the own hostel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Good low budget place on a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Theatermeiske
Reviews.Content: In contrast of most of the reviews about this hostel, I found it very good! I traveled through Central America and Asia, so maybe I've less expectations. Me and my friend stayed here for 2 weeks:) I've paid 21 euro per person per night (that's included the tax of 3,50 dollar that you have to pay everywhere in the states!) We checked 3 rooms before paying, so yes, it is possible! (Maybe it depends on the person whose working at that moment..) We chose for room nr. 3. A doubleroom with a bunkbed, which was okay. The beds were big, only the matresses weren't that good. There was a sink that worked, only the tv didn't work, but yeah, who wants to watch tv in this amazing city anyway?!!:D The only minor "bad" thing was the bathroom nearest to our room. The water didn't heat up there. But there were 2 bathrooms in each wing, so 4 on each floor, and those were okay. And as for cleanliness.. What do you expect?? It's not a 5 star hostel! The bathrooms are cleaned every day, they clean your rooms whenever you ask for it, you can ask for clean towels every day, so for me it was perfect! There's (quit expensive) internet (3 dollars per half hour, but in New York internet is expensive everywhere), and most of the staff were really kind! (Except one blonde guy..) And it's quiet, we never heard loud noises or something like that. Anyway, my opinion is: A good place to stay in a great location! Best for younger travelers, young couples and people traveling solo, but NOT for couples with children or elderly people.

Reviews.Title: “You wont pay what you reserved”
Reviews.Author: liquidnitroz
Reviews.Content: The hostel bathrooms were quite dirty. Housekeeping no longer makes beds and you must ask to have them made. The reservation staff is wonderful though. However, you will not pay what you reserved at all because they will cheat you and you will pay around 35 and up more than what you reserved. This is not recommended for people traveling on a budget because you will need to pay more than you budgeted. It is actually a nice hostel, with the exception of the bathroom, making beds thing, and the price scam. Other hostels charge what you booked. Everything is in cash....

Reviews.Title: “Absoulte dump, there was [--] all over the bath!!!”
Reviews.Author: frankie12344321
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip with school thinking I was going to enjoy a 'boutique' hostel. From the outside it looks tremendous, just one step into the door and you still feel it could be a nice place with the reception clean and neat. Then, I got my key and went into my room and there was 1 bunkbed and a sink and a broken tv. May I say that the sink had poo on it also have you seen the rats running around the corridors. I went up to the third floor and there was actually more poo in the bath. And a red thing thing stuck to the wall. Everyone stank because of the lack of nice showers and hygeine. Please, please do not go there you will regret it. Oh and you can't even sleep, my mattress was falling through. Enjoy the holiday, pick somewhere else please I'm begging you!!

Reviews.Title: “it worths to pay $40 more and go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: alexfromspain
Reviews.Content: I'm 23 years old, I love travelling and I don't mind to spend a night in a bad place if thus I can save some $. In fact, I've been in a really bad hostels but I think this is the worst I've ever been. I spend only one night in the hotel with my girlfriend. Dirty rooms, no tables where you can leave your clothes.The blankets were really old, few toilets for all the guests....That's what we had for $100 one night. The previous nights we stayed in a hotel called park79, which is pretty close to west end, we payed $130 per night and I can assure you if I had known, I'd have payed these $40 more. They don't keep your baggage, you have to put it in a locker for $5, Internet service for $2/10 minutes.I didn't see any bugs If you are young, like the "adventure" and you want to save money, maybe is your place. But I'd never recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Website all lies! heres the real westside studio photos and its a health risk!”
Reviews.Author: dgare
Reviews.Content: look at my photos and ask yourself would you pay money to stay here? It's a rip off. You cant see your room before handing over the cash. No refunds if you want to leave. Please, whatever you do, do not spoil your trip to New York by staying here. It's the worst hostel experience I have EVER had, and I spent three years traveling around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of much more praise.”
Reviews.Author: Danny_88
Reviews.Content: After arriving in New York to the horrors of Dexter House, my girlfriend and I were on the lookout for a cheap alternative, and it's fair to say that West End Studios was a Godsend. We were greeted at the front desk very warmly, in fact the service throughout our stay was exceptional (except on weekends when the men take over). We were allowed to see a variety of rooms before settling on one that looked flawlessley clean, included a TV and a surprisingly good view. We were also impressed that we had a wireless connection in our room. The bathrooms were cleaned thouroughly on a daily basis, and if someone had decided they didn't need to clean up after themselves then there were many more bathrooms to choose from. There is a free laundry service available in the basement, and storage lockers for $5 per day, something we felt comfortable enough to use during a two-day trip to Niagara. We enjoyed our stay immensely, it proved a cheap place to stay with high standards in an excellent location. We'd certainly return, don't worry about other reviews, we found no evidence of bed bugs and no other guests seemed to encounter that problem either during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Digusting and depressing”
Reviews.Author: lovermp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as a last resort because something got mixed up with a reservation we had at another hostel,so we were quite desperate for a place to stay. As soon as we walked in I was horrified and embarrassed by what I saw! There was only a fluorescent light that took a second to turn on. The carpet was thin and stained,there was a crack at the bottom of the door about 5 inches thick. The bathroom was just barely clean enough to feel safe. We had bedbugs. The only good things was that,at least we had an AC since it was summer. The location was OK and the neighborhood was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Take your sleeping bag and towel...just in case”
Reviews.Author: elemesde
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there, and I've seen some of the reviews before, but because of the location and the short time of the stay we went there...and the price. (which is cheap in NY but not somewhere else) The room looked clean, but I've red about the bedsheets and we've found those hairs on the pillows and in the bed, which meant, it hasn't been changed after the last (few?) guests. We took our sleeping bags with us so we left the beds as clean as they were before ;-( And we also took our towels . It worths.!!! Bathroom were clean but there wasn't any curtains on the window so it was a bit uncomfortable. But we haven't seen any of those cockroaches and bed-bugs...luckily It was really hot even during the night and the air-conditioning was placed by our heads, and it was so loud that we couldn't sleep. We've stayed, because we spent the all day in the city and we went back to the hotel only in the evening. ...you can survive!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Short Stays and Budget”
Reviews.Author: Chickaroo102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here knowing it would be just one night. Sightseeing all day and with friends most of the night. Just needed a place to put luggage and crash in for a few hours. After booking this place for the price and location (still pricey for what you get) we had an adequate stay. We did not find bed bugs in our room, after reading reviews of so many that did, we got lucky I guess. I brought a glove and wipes just in case and did an inspection of the room and mattress when we arrived. We did bring our own flat sheet and pillow case though which I am very glad we did. Definitely used that and felt more comfortable and wore shoes or flip-flops the entire time. We stayed just one night so did not have to shower, and hopefully you will bring wipes or something to clean yourself with so you won't have to either. Not terrible bathrooms, I just couldn't shower in there. Everything seemed about as clean as it could be considering. Front desk people were nice enough and answered what questions we did have. We did also use lockers for our luggage the second day and that worked out really well. Good location. Felt safe to take subway back late at night/early morning. Close to station on Broadway, Close enough to eat breakfast at Central Park. Overall tolerable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hell hole in New York”
Reviews.Author: PopMack
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most squalid, depressing, run down and disgusting hotels in New York - dark, dingy atmosphere, loose electric fixtures, stained, threadbare sheets that look as though they're changed after every fifth use, mould, mildew, bugs.. If you're lucky you might get an old TV set that actually works in which case it could come in handy to drown out the sounds of the couple in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “We liked this place!!”
Reviews.Author: intheheights63
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it isn't the ritz, but what do you expect for the prices you pay! We paid about £100 for a ten night stay, that was about $200 a time! At first we were a bit like woah, we can't stay here, but then we remembered who cares, we're only sleeping there! The room we'd booked had gone, but we got upgraded anyway! We arrived at like 11pm, that was no problem, and the woman behind the desk (yay heidi!) helped us with pretty much anything we needed. ended up spending a lot more time in the hostel than we thought because it was a cool atmosphere! i'd stay there again! as for the bathrooms, the cleaners were there at least once a day!! they were ALWAYS clean.

Reviews.Title: “Shared Room With Old Homeless Guy. Not Kidding.”
Reviews.Author: LucyGloriosa
Reviews.Content: West End Dosshouse, more like... As we found out, it is apparently also used as emergency accomodation for the city's homeless. We shared a dorm room with a sixty-something homeless guy who kept all his belongings (mostly bric a brac, costume jewellery and toiletry samples) in bags and boxes all over the room, and kept us up playing with his rings with the light on. I was suspicious, as the poor guy was hardly the typical backpacker, and when he was out I noticed some papers on his bed - on closer inspection, they were documents between the City and West End Studios placing him there. Sorry, but this is so not on when you pay for a hostel. Yes, it was cheap, but you do not expect to be in a situation like that, especially if you're a young woman. And yes, as the other reviews say, the place is a complete dump. Apart from the reception area, which is incongruously gorgeous, giving the impression of a classy place. Don't be fooled! It's like camping out in a long since abandoned house. I think the dorms are especially bad, and the bathrooms were pretty uninviting. Water was leaking through the bathroom ceiling. Oh yes, and we got trapped in the lift in the basement at one point too. If you're going to New York, let this be your last resort - book somewhere nice in advance to make sure you won't have to resort to this dosshouse.

Reviews.Title: “You Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sarahf25
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 nights. It was fine. I was looking for an inexpensive private room. Yeah, it did not have much but you are not paying for much. The staff were very freindly were fine to ask questions. Requested housekeeping once and they came. The location is out of the busy part of the city with many store and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “West End Studios - Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kjd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at West End Studios last week and there was nothing wrong. It does not deserve its bad reviews. If you book directly it is cheaper, and for this price it was perfect. The staff were friendly and when we checked in they gave us the option to look at our room first. The room is basic, but they provide towels and there is a maid service if you ask for it. If not they leave your room alone. The heating was a little sporadic but not hard to deal with! The bathrooms were clean and pleanty of them, one shower was a little broken but not so that it affected its use. Honestly if you want a cheap place to stay its a bargain, inbetween 2 subway stops and a starbucks v close! Dont be worried about the other reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Cold and dank!”
Reviews.Author: tbed399
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday afternoon, and from the street the hotel looked okay. Once we got to our room that was another story! First our room was on the sixth floor, and the elevator only went up to the fifth floor, we had to get off and walk the rest of the way up. Stepping off the elevator and walking up the dark cramped stairwell, we became frightened. The room was small and run down. Everything looked like it was falling apart and put together with watered down paste, and beleve me it was. The bed was a nightmare, and should have been put into a dumpster long ago. The carpet was dirty and worn, and the paint job looked like they had put about 10 layers over crumbling peeling paint. We asked the girl at the desk for a room change, but told us there were no more rooms available. The bathrooms are tiny, and seemed clean enough, but in the morning I saw the cleaning person who was using a mop from a dirty bucket of water use the same mop that she had just cleaned the floor with to clean the bathtub! She just slopped it around in the tub and that was it the cleaning job was done. It was freezing as well, and that night I went down to ask the desk clerk to please turn the heat on. I was met with a glare so intense and so hateful I was shocked. He rudely told me that the boiler was on a timer and it would be coming on later, and then went back to fiddling with his laptop, completly ignoring me. Around 11pm the heat came on with such a commotion and clatter I thought the building was collapsing! The heat shut off again around 1am and we froze the rest of the night. The next day was Saturday, as we were staying the wekend and leaving Monday morning. I figured the young man from the night shift gone, so it would be safe to approach the front desk again, NO SUCH LUCK! He was there, he worked every shift the entire weekend that we were there, personally I think he was some kind of zombie. A very rude and unsympathetic person. Accidently Saturday evening we took the elevator to the basement, they have lockers down there, and a fuseball table. There was some beat up furniture that I was afraid to sit in and my husband told me he saw rat droppings. We met a very nice young man doing his laundry down there, he told us that he lived in the hotel, but that it was not a real hotel. The building is supposed to be used to house low income people, and some people do live there, about a dozen he said. He told us that the owners of the building are using it illegally as a hotel, since most people who would live their would pay between $100-$200 dollars per week, and they make more money by having unsuspecting tourists stay there. And sure enough we were out having brunch Sunday at a restaurant and they had a news program on there that was doing a story about illegal hotels in Manhattan. Although the report did not mention West End Studios, the reporter said that it is a big problem in the city, and that many low income people are being forced out of these places by unscruples landlords. We felt horrible about staying their, not only was the place a dump, but we were keeping a poor person from having a roof over their head. When we were checking out Monday morning I asked the girl at the desk about this, but she pretended that she didn't know what I was talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Alcatraz style accomodation”
Reviews.Author: rossella78
Reviews.Content: upon arrival the receptionist put us up to the 6th floor, an abandoned part of the buildings. We were impressed by the squallor of the room - a prison cell must look better for sure. Pipes all over the place, old brown carpet, old stinking bed. The lift was not working nor the heater!!! we were moved down on the second floor, a slightly more decent one, still pipes all over the room, always prison style. I could not have a shower - the bath were very small and old, and unfortunately the hosekeepers forgot to clean the bath tub, which was a bit of a mess then. Toilets looked cleaned at least, and paper only (no soap) filled in regularly. The lounge is in the basement, among the rest of boilers, washing machines - mostly looked like a garage. Funny enough, no one at the reception told me about it, I found it out the last day when I used the lockers for the luggage (5$). For the money I paid, I expect more. The building is seriously looking as if it's falling a part. Hopefully for the same price (standard private double avg. 55£ /110$ a night is not nothing) one should get something more decent in new york.

Reviews.Title: “what do you expect for $81 per night?”
Reviews.Author: homeperm
Reviews.Content: i was in pretty desperate need of a hotel in NYC at short notice and there weren't many options, even if i wanted to pay $500 per night (which i didn't). but west end studios had a room available which could sleep three for $81 per night. the place is simple and busy. the paint work and colour scheme were terrible. and the beds were at risk of collapse. it was not flash. but the bathrooms, which were shared, seemed pretty clean, there was an ATM there and computers with internet access ($1 for ten minutes) vending machines and lockers. and it's about three minutes walk from a subway station, which means of course that the rest of new york is only one or two subway rides away. i would hope that next time in new york my accomodation was sorted out in advance so i wasn't forced to stay in the west end studios again, but if i were in the same situation i would return there without hesitation. it met most of my expectations with only some slight disappointment from me that the elevator was broken and i was on the 6th floor. (a final note, the reception desk at the hotel has a sign saying something like: preorder taxi to la guardia for $45 plus tolls and tips. this "deal" is a rip off. the actual cost to la guardia from the west end studios was around $28 plus tip).

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for, but you may wanna pay $20 more/ night to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: yiuyiu_tai
Reviews.Content: My travelmate and I really did expect the worse from this place. Thank goodness our stay was tolerable. Here's why they barely made the grade: - The neighborhood was nice, and when we got there we were given a room on the top (6th) floor; - We didn't experience any problems with bedbugs (nor did I see anyone else staying there scratching themselves); - Our communal bathrms/showers happened to have been cleaned on the day we checked in on Sunday. Then they maintenanced and cleaned it again that Wednesday. Note that you should bring a pair of extra flip-flops for bathroom trips, like how I used to in a college dormitory; - Our bed was ok. The white sheets didn't look super old. Though we did find a couple random strands of head and body hair on them, the sheets otherwise look clean and (more importantly) stain-free; - The pillows were probably incredibly old. The fiber stuffing inside was fairly lumpy. But at least they didn't stink; - Since our stay was during the tail end of summer, the room was sweltering, even at night. I kinda had a problem going to sleep because of how hot it got; - Lastly, the front desk clerks were not friendly, none of them. They did snappily hand me an extra bathroom towel when asked for one. Unless they're the only person who could've helped me with something, I refused to ask them for any help with anything. In conclusion, you could do this hotel. But it may be uncomfortable enough (summertime, yikes). If you're able to lodge somewhere that charges a little more but covers the basics better, you should just go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “HOT! HOT! No Air Conditioning!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: texanlily
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for a week, due to budget. We were supposed to have two beds but ended up with one! The room wasn't that bad but we had NO AIR CONDITIONING!!! None of the rooms have A/C. So if you are staying more than 3 days I would not recommend it. For us ladies, prepare to have your makeup melted off before you get downstairs!!! The room had a small fan, fridge and tv. I would have loved to have A/C instead of the fridge or tv. We did not stay in the room that much because it was cooler outside than it was inside. You have to share the bathrooms on the floor with the other guests also. The front desk people only allow you to have one towel. so make it last. GoodLuck if your gonna stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful [--]”
Reviews.Author: Matti123
Reviews.Content: Totally an awful place. We thought a _HOTEL_ cannot be this [--] hole, but we were wrong. And we have travelled in eastern Europe where there is all kind of things around. The hotel is rather decent area in Manhattan, so we though you could not find a hotel like this from there. Stay out. Check the Big Apple hostel close to Time Square. It was only twice as expensive (which is still quite low price) and you have direct access to Times Square and all the fun. Byebye then.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hostel ever in my life!”
Reviews.Author: SuperGonzo
Reviews.Content: The rooms (and the hotel in general) were far from clean. There were still hairs on the basin inside the room from the previous occupants. The first room we got (so called "en-suite") had a toilet inside the room (not on a different room or with a door separating beds and toilet) running water all night just 2 metres from the beds. Following day, we got locked in the basement (where the lockers for the luggage were) because somebody left the door of the lift open on another floor and the only access was using the lift! Not safe in case of a fire and I have my doubts that it is legal to have such a space without other means of access especially when considering that all the electric wires were on the ceiling, exposed and clearly in a dangerous state. For more than one day there was no hot water available for the shower and the towels available for the shower were dirty (we bought our owns and refused to use the ones made available!). Unfortunately non-expensive places in NY fill up rather quickly, therefore we couldn't afford to move somewhere else so we had to spend an entire week at West End Studios & Hostel. The location, albeit not close to the centre, was not too bad considering that tends to be considerably cheaper than central locations.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place i've never seen !”
Reviews.Author: petitefleur
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hostel in october 2004, just found out about the reviews today unfortunatly.When i started to read the other comments, remind me alot of bad memories....This place is grimmy, would be more safe to sleep in the street (and more clean probably).The first room they showed us had no light, was really filthy, we asked for an other room, the other room was even worst (yes it is possible!!), we finaly took the last one they showed us which was about the same but with light and it was at the first floor..Hard time to sleep with a door that does not close right.We were really desesperated but had no choice for 2 nights to stay there...We had plenty maps of New york that we layed down on the floor to not step directly on the carpet..We had plenty visitors all kind of insects (cucarachas..).The floor and the bed were almost collapsing, the sink was looking worst than a grimmy trash can.Not enough words to express this degusting place! Believe this other negativ review.Don't go or send your worst enemy !lol

Reviews.Title: “Old, but OK”
Reviews.Author: jwheat74
Reviews.Content: The place is old and a little run down, but the location and price are good. I didn't see any bugs, stains and or hair in my room. The people at the front desk were very nice. They let me check in a couple of hours early, so no complaints there. If you have lived in a dorm, barracks or hostel, before and it didn't bother you then you won't have any problems staying here. My tip for breakfast: Make left out the door of West End. At the end of block make another left. On the right on the coner of Broadway there is a small deli that serves good & cheap breakfast sandwiches/coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty,dirty dump!”
Reviews.Author: sakabaka
Reviews.Content: Place was dump!!!!! It is infested with cockroaches, dirty bed sheets, soiled carpets, squeaky beds and impossible to lock the doors on your room properly (it looks like its been broken into on several occasions). Luckily, weather was good, so we did not have to deal with the issue of our windows being impossible to close (oh, I would be afraid of winter in there). When we arrived our beds were filthy, full of someone’s hair. Plumbing was hanging from ceilings. To top it off, water was leaking (a lot!!!!!)Through the ceiling from bathroom above, and protruding through light fittings. Whole ceiling looked like is going to collapse. I would advice anyone who has chance to stay anywhere else to do so. This place is cheap, but not worth your money. Pictures on their web are untrue and our rooms looked nothing like those on the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all!!”
Reviews.Author: sojen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with my boyfriend on hostels.com website because it apparently had a positive rating from the customers and it was quite cheap. But do not trust the photos!! The rooms on the photos are only a few, situated on the 6th floor. all the others are dirty and old. We first had a problem with the sheets (there were dirty), then a noise problem because of the bathroom door that was neer our room that had to be slammed by people, we finally ended in one of the rooms which are on their photos but the toilet had a problem and made noise all night long. Moreover, the staff is not helpful at all. I do not recommand this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Eri35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place for a week in November. I thought all the rooms came with a TV, a sink, and a fridge. Not my room. It only had a bed. The carpet was disgusting!!!! It was filthy!!!!! As I had paid for the room in advance, had to stick with it for a week. Yes, and I did spot a cockroach. People at the reception weren't so bad. There are two computers at the reception area that the guests can use to surf the net, but they are not for free. You have to pay minimum 2 dollars, which gives you 20 minutes of net connection. The bathrooms were usually clean. I paid 55 dollars a night for weekdays, and 100 dollars a night for weekends. Outrageously priced. One good thing about this place is its location. Very close to the subway station. The neighborhood is nice and safe. I will not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Bad Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: giome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hostel for two nights in March and it was the worst place I have been to in my life. The floor, sheets and bathroom was disgusting. I asked the "staff" for new clean sheets and when I went to put them in the bed it had hair on it. I t was a really bad experience. The entrance looks nice but the rooms are terrible dont waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: hilaryjeant
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed three nights and we were pleasantly surprised - it is basic and it is a one star but it has all the facilities you need i.e comfy bed and clean sheets. The room was small but had a fridge, TV and wash basin - we were on the 6th floor (91 stairs up as lift wasn't working when we got there!) The staff were friendly and helpful and there was internet access available and washing machines and dryers and lockers for baggage after check out in the basement. Hotel is close to subway, only takes 15 minutes to get downtown. For the price it was OK - if you spend a long time in your room you are not enjoying New York!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: szymonpoland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hostel for 3 nights. I had single room with restroom without doors, washbowl, tv and decent fan. Linen and towels were fresh and clean(if you ask for new towel, you will receive new one at the front desk). Badrooms weren't broken, water was hot. You don't have to stay in line - is quite a big number of badrooms at each floor. Hostel is situated in fashionable and safety area near Brodway. I booked the room in advanced and paid for 1 night 35USD(including state tax). It is really great value for your money. I have no idea why this hstel is underrated by visitors......

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rmarcial
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that it's a hostel and not a hotel, I could have done without the cockroaches and the previous tenant's hair on my pillow cases. I can't recommend this place even though it's very affordable. I've heard good things about the YMCA, so I'll try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: ToastoftheTown
Reviews.Content: The absolute best the Big Apple has to offer! Last October myself and 3 friends made a trip to NYC and decided to reside at this quaint establishment for the duration of our stay. We are now planning a return trip this month and it deeply saddens me to see the previous reviews posted on this website. This place was nothing short of spectacular and made our trip that much more enjoyable. Obviously this is not the Ritz Carlton, but for the price you will not find a better place to stay. The staff was genuinely friendly and always had our best interests in mind. From the first moment we entered, it became apparent that our safety was their number one concern. I was surprised at how nice the accommodations actually were and the bathroom facilities were undeniably immaculate. The four of us stayed in one room (financial reasons!) which left myself and a friend to sleep on the floor for our stay. My friend made the comment that even the comfort of the floor was comprable to that of a Craftmatic Adjustable Bed. I honestly encourage anyone looking for a cost effective place to stay while visiting NYC to consider staying at this facility. Your trip will be that much more intoxicating, this much I promise you.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: crodri9
Reviews.Content: First off, when we got there, they didn't have the room we had reserved. Second, the sheets had black hairs all over them. The day we checked out I noticed raised, red, itchy bumps on my stomach, arms and legs... I counted 56 of them. Google searched bed bug bites and they match exactly. Really sucks. I contacted the hostel and told them about the bed bugs. Hope they do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Andrexxx
Reviews.Content: As one reviewer said, "it's not the Hilton". No, and it's barely the Hilton's boiler room, I suspect. First, the young man greeting me behind the counter was not only indifferent, he was simply rude. And it got worse. Filthy carpets; cracked, stained walls, poor security. And the worst part - bed bugs. Ick. If these things don't bother you, then go for it. But frankly, saving a few bucks comes with a big price. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “horrid dirty place”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg712
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting really fithy. Dont go by the pics you see on the websites the place is nothing like it. Beds are unsafe and sheets were also dirty and had hairs on them. there was also snot all over the walls. Bathroom cant even put it in words. We got put to their sister hotel which was not much better apart from the sheets were clean at least not much else. All else i can say is spend a few more quid and get somewhere thats gonna be clean. Apart from that new york is a brill place to go...

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleeping in off season”
Reviews.Author: GreekGazelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hostel 2 days end of Sept. Had a private double room. The Hostel wasn`t very full, so I guess I got a quite good room for the facility. Had A/C, fridge , bassin and a very old TV working "a little". When many people are there chance of getting very bad room. The front desk said there are rooms she would not like to put people in. During our stay 2 of 4 bathrooms were in order on floor, the elevator was not working. The room was simple and in a very bad shape (ceiling, bassin, door?!?!?!), cleanliness I guess quite ok (no eating on floor though :-). Great location, near the sub, neighboorhood seems quite safe. Internet 2$ for 10 min. (min. 20 min.). If U stay be sure to visit bagle-factory for breakfast! I would do it again for the price. It´s good for that price in New York, if U can live with the negatives! But only off-season, because our room was in a bad shape, don`t want to see the other rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: fghra
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online, and from pictures that we found on internet it looked simple but clean. When we got there it wasn't even close to the pictures what we got. First of all, we we afraid to stay there. The doors of our room had hole between frame and doors. The carpet was very dirty. All four beds in the room had lots of hair on it. My sister and I couldn't sleep all night because of spring mattres (it was so worn out that I felt only spring under my body) and creaky bed. I guess we were lucky, we didn't see any cockroaches and mice. It wouldn't be a surptice. The bathroom was the same as the room: dirty, hairy and wet. My sister took shower with her shoes on. I even didn't dare take a shower. The only good thing about this hotel that it was only one block from subway. And we were very lucky, we had AC in our room. But I wouldn't stay in this hotel even for free next time. It was nightmare with no rest, no sleep and counting minutes until the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Gave us a nightmare ...”
Reviews.Author: GalaksiaFervojo
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the front desk, we were defintely stunned. The clerk explained there's no room left even though we reserved 3 months in advance! He didn't even show any apologies but just redirect us to the "sister" hotel, which located 107th St. We just complained about it but he was a our-way-or-highway like guy. So we were forced to move up to the new place and literally horrified when we got there. We just can't call it "a hotel." It was really shabby, a mass of malfunctions. The elevator was worse than out of order: it lifted us to the wrong floor, sometimes to somewhere between them (2.5th floor?) The shower didn't pour hot water (maybe we were a little bit lucky as it's in August.) The room's light sometimes didn't turn on. And we had to stay there for over two weeks ... That was the "NIghtmare on 107 St..."

Reviews.Title: “Afraid To Stand Still”
Reviews.Author: KDKpranks
Reviews.Content: This place is so dirty and decrepid that I am amazed that it hasn't been condemned. It's filthy, smelly, dank and disgusting. We arrived and stayed for a weekend at the end of June 2006. First-off, the elevator is a frightening deathtrap waiting to happen. The halls are filthy and littered with garbage. The door to the room didn't fit in the frame and anyone could clearly look in. You could also tell that the door had been kicked in many times as it was clearly badly damaged and poorly-repainted many times. The carpeting of the room was littered with cigarette burns. For the fun of it, I moved the bed and underneath I found a box of old condoms and several tissues that I shudder to think of what DNA was contained therein. The room DID have a working sink, dorm fridge, fan and TV, which is about all I could say good about it. On the second day we stayed there, the elevator had broken down (big surprise) and he had to take the narrow stairwell, which was littered with dead bug carcasses, though I never did see a LIVE bug. But after seeing the dead bugs, I was afraid to stand still in one place for too long for fear that things might crawl up my leg. The bathroom was, of course, filthy and littered with pubic hairs and god knows what else. The clerk at the front desk was consistantly angry, unfriendly and unhelpful, usually not even bothering to get off his cellphone to help us. Even the outside of the building was a mess with wires running from window to window, presumably for cable TV. There was even dog feces on their front steps when we showed up. Bottom line is you shouldn't stay here no matter how cheap or desperate you are.

Reviews.Title: “It's a hostel, I didn't expect much”
Reviews.Author: nomadgirl1
Reviews.Content: First, I booked on Orbitz, and ended up overpaying. If I were to stay again, I'd book directly through the hotel. It's not bad. It's a hostel, so it's a little run down, a little communal, but the staff was extremely nice and helpful. I didn't mind the shared bathrooms - they were clean. The tv was wasted space in the room, as the reception was non-existent. I was worried about the door to my room - very flimsy with holes in it. There's no way it would have kept anyone out if they wanted in. Thus I was nervous about leaving my things, and ended up paying to keep my valuables in a locker in the basement. I'd book again in a pinch, it wasn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Geisya
Reviews.Content: It was Not bad. We booked with hostelworld. Price was great and room was simple and clean. Staff was helpful. We stayed in room with Bunk Bed with my boyfriend. There was no A/C, but we have a window to take fresh air. I cannot believe the bad comment on this site. How much they paid and what they expect more. By the way, we paid $17 each. It was great deal. Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Horror hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights in a single bed room in this hotel thinking it would look something like the pictures on their web site. When I arrived I found out that these pictues must have been taken in the hotel manager's home. My room was so small that I couldn't quite open up my suitcase on the floor. My bed was a rusty army bunk bed with torn sheets and a strange see-through cover. Used chewing gum in the floor carpet. I knew there would be no air conditioning but I thought I might be able to open a window but only managed to make a small crack with lots of effort. Dirt everywhere. Bed sheets in stead of curtains. Paint peeling of the walls. No door knob - I had to close the door with the key and the lock would not have resisted a good push, adding to my discomfort already established by some sinister inhabitants. TV next to useless due to lousy reception. The room didn't even have the alarm clock they proudly claim to be in every room! The reception clerks' truly gentle demeanor and the apparent abscence of insects did not suffice to make my stay any more bearable. Receiving a foreigner in such a way, one who has been travelling all day (from Iceland to be precise), exhausted, way too hot and insecure in a strange place with no connections is simply a horribly mean thing to do. Shame on them! I must commend this hotel for one thing though ... I got help from a kind NYer who provided me with a b'n'b deal in his friend's apartment and when I left the WES the reception only charged me for the one night I stayed there. I guess they are used to people fleeing from the building.

Reviews.Title: “good place for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean hotel in a quiet neighborhood. Very accomodating clerk, who quickly resolved our minor issues. room was big and bright. dont expect top of the line amenities or furniture, but you are not paying for that either. if you want posh amenities that come with a hefty NYC price tag then stay elsewhere, but if you are a tourist like we were and looking to esxplore NYC and have a clean and comfortable place to sleep, then book this hotel. We found shared bathrooms not to be a problem as there are 2-3 on each floor and only 8-10 rooms per floor. a word of advice: book directly on their website: [---------------------] so that you dont have to pre-pay for yoru reservation in advance. We booked on orbitz and had to pay upfront, and only later found this hotels website that had a better rate, but of course online travel sites charge you a big cancellation fee to discourage cancellations, so it wasnt worth cancelling this time around. well, we know for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Troubles!!!!!Here???????Never!!!!!!!!!??????????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I heard such a terrible comments about this place that I couldnt belive that this place is still running a buisness....:)))) We arrived 2 o'clock in the afternoon and we were ready to wait for the room till the check-in time (3pm). We did not have to. Front desk clerks took care of us immidiately. They gave us a room with two double beds and a bunk - really big, newly renovated (working TV, new sink, windows, clean carpet, pictures!!!!! on the wall). We also found a towels and soap on the beds and when we needed more we were getting it from the reception. The room service is only upon the request, so if you want the housekeeper to clean your room you have to ask about this and leave the key at the front desk. We never see even one bed bug or roach here!!!!!! (we were very careful at this point - we checked every bed before laying down on it):))). -------------------------------------------------- We were visiting New York first time and we did not have an idea were to go. All of the information about tours, museums, clubs!!!!, locations of each place we were interested in, free city guide, subway map and a great service we get from the front desk. Really!!! They really know how to take care of the guests and they are ready to help you in every matter. They have also the internet access in the lobby! -------------------------------------------------- The location of West End Studios is also great. The neighborhood is really safe. Just one block to the deli's if you need food, drinks, cigarettes, phone cards....one block to places where you can have your breakfast: Starbacks, diners, bagel places. Subway station is near to the hostel (1-train, which will take you actually to every attraction in the city: Times Squere, World Trade Center, ferry to Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building.... -------------------------------------------------- After all (we stayed 5 nights) we did not want to go and we extend the reservation for 2 more days:)))) (we change our flight). We had a very good time and defenetly we will come next year to bring back the memories:)))))))) Of course we will come back to West End Studios because of the 3 reasons: - very friendly front desk - great location - very good price (I never expected to find a place for this money in Manhattan!!!!!) Thank you for the great vacation.... Rebeka

Reviews.Title: “You can't believe everything you read...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several negitive reviews and with no where else to go we went to the West End Studios as I needed to be in this area for a meeting. I was most pleased with the quality of service, and professionalism I was greeted with. This hotel is more like a hostel but honestly it was great. The rooms where clean, very clean, and based on reading some reviews before I layed down I inspected the beds, Glad to say they were very clean as well. All in all "You can't always believe what you read" I learned from this experience to try things for myself before I listen to Strangers. West End Studios, you might not be the best but you were great for me, and I WILL BE BACK SOON. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed two nights April 8/9, 2006. DO NOT stay here - its BED BUG heaven. I paid US$200 for approximately 80 bites that I don't want and I've probably brought the little blighters home with me in my backpack. If you have to stay here read on: shower before everyone else 6am (bathrooms are clean then); elevator doesn't work (we were on the top floor); TV has 2 channels if you're lucky; there's a lot of loud noise from the heating pipes. If all other places you've tried are full and like us you come accross this place with a vacancy - don't do like we did - ask yourself why is there a vacancy here? Go away, go far, far away.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyholiday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the West End Studios last November - as a romantic break from becoming new parents! We have travelled a lot and are quite worldly, but the accomoodation ruined our whole stay. We arrived on the Friday only to be told we couldn't have our room as there had been some flooding but they would put us up in their 'sister' hotel 'The Continental' - and assured us it was of the same standard. So we walked several blocks to 'The Continental' and it was so awful I just cried. We were totally dismayed - at 10.00pm in a strange City with no-where else to go and no way of contacting anyone at home as it was the early hours of the morning in the UK. The place was so filthy, we had never seen anything like it - with rubble in the hallways and several unsavoury characters around. We went back the the West End studios and complained and said it wasn't good enough and we were actually too scared to stay there, but they wouldn't offer anything else. Being faced with the streets or 'The Continental' we stayed for one night only - in metal framed bunk beds - with sheets nailed to the windows and crumbling ceilings. Clearly several people lived there and every move we made was watched. The bathrooms were so filthy we refused to wash there, and moved a large dresser in front of the door to sleep!! As for the 'West End Studios' basically it was a youth hostel, with again sheets nailed at the windows, and very old and dirty bathrooms, dirty bedrooms - not the holiday hideasway we had hoped for and it ruined our trip. I have to say though the guy on reception was very very friendly and helpful - nice guy, but terrible place!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place ever, ever, and it contributed to make my visit to New York a horrible experience.
