Some examples: - The receptionist the first day was rude; he seemed to be bothered every time I asked a question to him. And when I asked him for a blanket, he sent me to another room to look myself for one, and, of course, there were no blankets at all. Then I realized I could not request anything from the main desk. - The room was dirty. - The bed didn't have any blanket, so I was cold. - I found three INSECTS in my bed. - The second day the hot water was broken so I had to take a cold shower. - The second day the elevator was broken -I was in the 4th floor. So, really, this place was way too expensive considering all that I had to go through. I mean, nobody deserves an experience like this only because you are not at the Hilton. The third day, obviously, I just wanted to come back home and not to return to that place ever again. I have visited some hostels in the 'so called' third world, but they all have been clean, and the people nice. This people should be aware that they are not only making miserable the life of the 'customers' when they are staying there, but also that the impression they are giving about life in New York is aweful: unclean and dirty places, rude people. Really, too much.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several nights at the West End Studios, but I won't be going back. On the good side, the rooms are large, each room has a fridge, and the building feels relatively safe, even for a woman traveling alone. On the bad side, the rooms aren't particularly clean, the bathrooms are terribly unclean, the water pressure and temperature fluctuate wildly, the staff ranges from apathetic to downright rude, and the latest twist: I am covered in bites from the bed bugs I found in my bed after the first morning of my most recent stay. I reported the problem, but as with most problems I've reported here, I doubt much will be done about it. With the money I've spent on antihistamines and cortisone creams, I could have just stayed at the next tier up. Do yourself a favor: avoid being bitten by both your greed and the bed bugs. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: whatever you do, do not stay at this place even if its the last place on earth! me and my partner arrived here after seeing mis-leading pictures on the internet on 13th february 2006. Checked out after being shown 3 rooms its just a death trap and a hotel from hell!!! Go for the pensylvania hotel across from madison square gardens its brilliant. It would not surprise me if all the rooms in the west end studios don't get their doors kicked in regularly! Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here for 6 nights in Jan '06 and although basic facilities the room was clean and spacious (also recently decorated). The hotel is cheap, ideal for the budget traveller. I must admit i was alittle afraid of staying as i had read some terrible reviews beforehand but it really is okay. The staff are friendly and the lift is in working order and oh yes i never saw one bug!! The only small niggle was the radiators are alittle noisy in the night and the landings are looking alittle tired. There were plenty of guests staying and we never heard one complaint. I'd definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems Here!”
Reviews.Author: geefunk
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here in november. Booked a room with 2 full size beds...called a week before arrival to confirm and everything was fine. Arrived at night...checked in with ease...got a room (2nd floor) with two full beds and twin bunks(not that we needed them). Room had a working fridge, tv, closet, sink, and heater. Windows to the street but did not mind the street noise (its Nyc afterall). Windows had curtains and closed all the way (never had a need to open them). The ceiling light had a nice lantern fixture. Room was newly painted and had what seemed like new carpet. Door lock was a bit shady but worked fine. The bathrooms were cleaner than expected (wear flip flops in shower!). Beds had sheets and blankets, but we took our own. We also took our own toilet seat covers and towels. Not the best place in the world, but it worked for us. Never saw any bugs of any kind! Thats a big plus!Do think it should be less than $100 a night though. The proximity to the subway was great! Don't forget to check out Tom's Restaurant on 110th (i think) great breakfast! We'd stay there again! There are some horrible reviews about this place, so we were scared to stay there (saw reviews after booking). But everything was great! Never heard one person complain during our stay. Maybe we were lucky. ***also used the locker facilities downstairs to store our stuff since we had a late flight back. Very handy works nice...they have laundry facilities also that I didn't find advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Cost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place has no redeeming qualities, NONE, ZERO, ZIP: 1) The staff is so rude you just want to slap them. I know this is NY but come on. I guess they must be dealing with extremely dissatisfied customers all the time but I would expect a minimum of curtesy and understanding from a hostel staff. 2) The rooms are extremely DIRTY. I do not mean 'hostel-like mess' that the reasonable budget traveler might expect. I mean 'third-world dirty' folks: countless hairs/holes/stains in the sheets, dust everywhere, etc... 3) The rooms are NOISY. We went in December and the pipes for the heather were knocking loudly all night. We simply couldn't sleep. Please don't get me wrong: I am sensitive to the standards of budget accomodations having back-packed many summers through Europe. This place, however, ranks at the bottom of the list along with the 13 Euros/no windows room I rented in Lisbon a few years back. I agree with the previosu comments about why a place like this is allowed to advertise via the hotel web sites...it is truly a disgrace. Avoid at all cost...

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'd stay in New York City on my budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in West End Studios in feb of 2005. We loved the hotel the staff was very friendly. The hotel location is 2 blocks from the subway lines the 1 and the 9 which are the best subways to use when being a tourist in New York City. Our room was clean, no bugs, clean sheets and clean sharred bathrooms. Well worth the price and am planning to stay there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug City”
Reviews.Author: JodySeattle
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at West End Studios in New York City for 10-11-2005 to 10-15-2005 Hotel Address: 850 West End Avenue The pictures on the web show very simple but functional rooms. They advertise having an elevator, cable TV with remote and other amenities. This hotel should not be allowed to be in business. I knew it would not be the Ritz but I wouldn't want a dog to sleep there. I have stayed in 1-2 star hotels in other cities and they are basic, functional and are no more or less than represented. This hotel in no way lives up to it's description. Elevator does not work. TV does not have cable and remote does not work. Picture is just fuzz. Windows do not close completely bringing all the street noise into the room. There was no heat and it was cold the days we were there, necessitating using multiple blankets at night. The worst of it was on Thursday night, my daughter-in-law and myself kept waking up all night. We found in the morning that we had been bitten all night by bedbugs. We had killed at least 10, others got away. We packed up and moved to another hotel - costing us an additional $411 for one night for 2 rooms at the Days Hotel + cab fare to get there. I am hoping we did not bring any of this nightmare home. Having to hire exterminators to debug my condo is not a pleasant thought. This hotel should be blacklisted from all reputable websites. Consumers rely on the photos and descriptions on websites to bear some resemblance to reality. We also rely on websites to not sponsor broken-down, bug-infested hotels as legitimate lodging choices.

Reviews.Title: “fleabag ------- is a compliment!”
Reviews.Author: subdave
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh! My first trip to the Big Apple to see my daughter in her first off-Broadway play. I was so excited, or about as excited as an overweight, middle-aged, proud father could be! Through hotels -- " Have you got anything under 100 bucks on Manhattan? I hate paying 300 a night for a bed and a shower." I travel all over the USA and stay at Red Roofs, Studio 8, Motel 6, etc. for 50-80 bucks a night 'cause I am a cheap, self-deprecating millionaire! Nothing could have prepared me for this fiasco. I took the room key up the well-worn winding staircase to the second floor, passed the "lovely" community bathroom on the right, inserted the key in the next room and the door knob promptly fell off, a rudimentary hand-rigged plywood insert and all! I deftly put the lock and plywood 6"X6" platform back together, stretching my less than maven mechanical skills to the limit after entering the sordid looking squalor-pad, sporting one lame twin bed, circa 1930 bargain-basement, and a single overhanging lantern-type light putting out a maximum of 40 watts. What a dim, dingy hole in the wall --it would have been perfect for Ratso Rizzo (Dustin Hoffman) in Midnight Cowboy! There was a fully-depreciated (10X over) window A/C unit that, of course, did not work in the 85 degree heat of the room (I must be in hell, I thought). I went down to the front desk and was informed that the maintenance guy had already left, before 5, natch, but that my super-hero desk clerk would come to my humble abode and save the day. This is when the Saturday Night Live sketch kicked in! The guy found a wire hidden under the rug and after somehow finding the connecting plug on the ancient A/C unit, stuck the plugs together and -- POP! The emission of flaming sparks was quite entertaining, even though it was five months after the 4th of July! The poor guy literally smoked his hand with black soot and heat, gave me a dirty look as I kept in a belly laugh, and tore from the room like I was trying to knock him down with a taser gun, all without saying a word! It went downhill from there with over-booked room complaints, long waits at the front desk, and communal facilities. Needless to say, West End Studios provided me a memorable experience in NYC! Hotels sent me a 20 buck coupon to assuage the pain of my two night stay in purgatory -- no, it was actually hell! Remember that doorknob? It fell apart at least half a dozen more times and at one point was so messed up that I locked myself in the room for at least an hour, the whole time fidgeting with this jerry-rigged concoction! I didn't dare call the front desk guy as he was not my new best friend in NYC, based upon the A/C unit incident! Luckily the play went fairly well, a biblical farce about Job and his pet snake. Next time it's the Waldorf-Astoria, baby!

Reviews.Title: “It was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (a young couple from Iceland) find it very hard to even give this horrible hostel a single point, maybe a half point would be appropriate for the hostel's just being there. Our experience was utterly terrible, but here we will only mention the absolutely "worst-of" West End Studios. It should be noted that before arriving we had no expectations whatsoever. After all, we had booked a "cheap" hostel in NYC. First, we booked a double bed room, but when we arrived we got a disgusting prison-like fall-apart bunk-bed room with an unclosable window (in NYC!) and a dirty unflushable toilet almost at the head of the bed with no door and a urine-stained floor. We're not even speaking of the bed, just to avoid the thought of it. There was no help whatsoever to get from the main staff (not all of which seemed to understand very simple english). We were given another room the day after, almost equally horrible and disgusting, with see-through holes around the door, broken furniture, a lot of stains on the walls and almost no lighting (to keep you from seeing the filth, I imagine). We'll have to stop here, before breaking into tears, but in short, there was absolutely NOTHIING OK about this hostel, except for the location (to be fair).

Reviews.Title: “horrible horrible horrible --no electricity in the middle of night”
Reviews.Author: yes_spa
Reviews.Content: I felt so sorry that I didn't read the previous reviews before I booked this hotel on hotels. This hotel was nothing like the description or photos on its website. The room conditions were so bad that I felt I was living in ruins. The floor was not even level, same as the bed. You could feel each spring inside the mattress. Everthing said in the previous reviews was true. And, when I was there, the elevator was broken as well. When I arrived on the first night, I got a room on the 6th floor. it's the top floor, no elevator, no airconditioning, no TV, only a toilete next to the bed. Just like a prison cell. Around 12 midnight, the electricity was gone and it never came back until I left in the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family paid about $120 to stay here, and it was our worst hotel experience ever! I would rather sleep on the street. Actually, our friends had two nights booked there, and after the first night, they packed their bags, and the second night they slept at the airport!!!! It was so hot in the room. On their website it says they have airconditioned rooms. It's a lie! We went to the manager and asked him why he wrote that. He said "because some of the rooms have air conditioning", yeah as in, some rooms maybe have working fans. The TV's don't work, the carpet is dirty. Our carpet had a wad of gum, dust in all corners, something that looked like a dead maggot, and was peeling. The floor creeked everywhere you stepped I thought I would fall through. The elevator didn't work. I would never step foot in one of their showers. I didn't dare look under the blanket at the sheets, I just "slept" in my clothes. My family reserved a room for four people. When we got there we were given two separate rooms, on two separate floors. My parents were afraid to leave my sister and I alone in a room, so all four of us shared a bunk bed. My mom and dad slept on the single bottom bunk, while my sister and I slept on the top. By the way, the top bunk has no rails, so if I were to actually fall asleep, there would be a good chance I would roll off. We had a closet, with a toilet in it. Everyone there was like us, looking around and wondering what they were doing in that dump, and paying to be there too. The only thing that worked was the alarm clock, but we didn't need it, because we spent the whole night awake, staring at the passing minutes. At 4:00 am we were out of the hotel to catch our flight. I'm surprised I didn't see any cockroaches. These people run a fradulent business, I'm surprised someone hasn't stopped them yet. I have a feeling they're business is about to be closed down.... hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Summary: homeless may even turn down a room here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: dear all, must say i made the mistake of not reviewing this hostel before i went. agree with all the other reviews entirely. I booked a twin room for myself and a friend. arriving at midnight because of a delayed flight we just wanted to get some sleep. we were asked to pay upfront which i knew we were gonna have to do anyway as it states on the website. anyway we went upto our room getting ready to just crash for the night and on opening the door was horrified. oh my god...literally it was more than a sorry sight...i cant even think of the words to explain it ....im sure a homeless guys pit would have been more hospitable and clean. it was a bunk bed, not two singles like advertised, crammed into a space just big enough to fit it. Room 416 avoid it at all costs. the smell coming from an excuse for a sink was unbearable and made me vomit. plaster was falling off the walls, nails sticking out all over the place, electrical cables and wires dangling from the wall where an air conditioning unit had been ripped out. so no a/c, no tv as indicated on the internet booking form, no space to leave four large suitcases, a door that was almost impossible to lock and oh if your a lady dont expect the bathroom doors to lock. oh and the grossed thing about this room was the fact that the bed sheets looked like theyd not been washed for weeks, both myself and my friend had to pick off about 40 long brunette hairs off our sheets and pillow cases. we asked for new bed sheets and still we picked off hairs from the new ones. i think the cleaner (although i never saw her) must have some malting disorder. anyway after putting up with this room for a night we managed to change room the day after. we viewed 5 rooms being shown the one on the top floor last. they were all just as bad apart from the one on the top floor which was reasonable ie didnt smell, had a/c and a tv that almost worked well. i just couldnt believe that any of the other rooms could meet trading standards. we were on holiday and had been to san fran, miami and finally new york. on student budgets this was one of cheapest we found in ny. however it was still more expensive than the other places we stayed. on arriving therefore we expecting the hostel to offer a bit more than the other cheap places we stayed. how wrong and surprised were we. it was far worse ..its not even of hostel standards, prob why they tried to call it west end studios, must be grade below a hostel or something or perhaps transalates to homeless equivalents. we were so glad to leave and i felt so sorry for new folk just arriving. please dont stay here people, this place should have gone out of business years ago. oh and top it off the lifts never work and the staircase there is steep room enough for the width of one middle sized individual and nobody to pass you coming in the opposite direction. good luck lugging your cases up and down. disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont EVER make the mistake of staying in this hotel. Some hotel staff are very arrogant. No phones, stinky, cramped, dusty rooms. Not all rooms have A/C, some even dont have a fan. Following is the mail I sent to Cheaptickets, awaiting a response from them. When the reservation was made on your website, the Hotel description clearly mentioned "Air conditioning". But on arriving at the hotel on July 2, with the temperature hovering around 90, I was given a room with NO A/C, not even a fan. I then had to literally beg the receptionist to give me a room with atleast a fan. After much haggling, I got one. I had to undergo 2 sleepless nights with the hot air from the fan blowing at me. After persistent enquiries and screaming, I got to spend the next 2 days in a room with A/C, to much relief. It apears to me that this Hotel intentionally descriminates reservations made through websites like yours, offering the worst of the rooms available, as compared to people who come directly to the hotel, check the rooms and then make the reservations. This is not fair to people who trust websites like yours and travel from far off places with the assurance that they would surely get what they reserve. I urge you to take immediate action against the Hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “What a disgust, not even worth looking at!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this 'hostel' with 4 friends for a 21st birthday. We are all students and had a very tight budget so it seemed like an affordable place when we searched. As most people have been saying the elevator is broken and we were on the 11th floor.. as you can imagine, it was impossible carrying all of our suitcases down to the ground floor when it was our time to leave. The rooms are ridiculous, it is NOTHING like the pictures advertised on the net. The rooms are insecure, the staff are rude and tried to over charge us on the last night as we were checking out. The hotel is extremely UNCLEAN, so unclean in fact that all 5 of us came out in rashes when we got back to the UK. PLEASE TO NOT STAY HERE!!!!.. it is not worth it. Spend the extra money for security, cleanliness and most importanly to avoid rashes!!! This place is disgusting. All hotel websites should take this off their sites, and this place should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “should not feel unsafe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Now, let me state that I am not what you would call a 'budget minded' person. My family usually stays in 4* or 5* hotels. However, I went to several places with similiar prices while I played soccer during high school. My team would stay in something like a motel 8, and though there wasn't anything impressive about it, I never felt unsafe. This pathetic place is an exception. Since our flight had problems we had to spend the night (sigh) and so this seemed like a fine option since it was just one night... Well, let me just say that doors should be able to lock, and random people shouldn't be allowed to loiter about in front of places. It's creepy and suspicious. I won't repeat how poor the rooms were, since plenty of people have, but my main point is that if you want to save money, you should not have to sacrifice safety. If people don't want to spend $200 a night on a room, then they shouldn't have to worry about anyone just walking in the room while they sleep! Trip Advisor, take this place off your list!!!! please!!! It is a disgrace! Also, there is some logic to the statement that sleeping under a bridge would be just the same as- or even better than- sleeping here. Think about it: A guy is sleeping under a bridge, and a guy is sleeping in an unlocked hotel room. Do you steal from the guy under the bridge or the guy in the hotel room? Where are you less likely to be seen? There are cars driving by to witness the theft when you're stealing from a guy under a bridge... Also, Who is more likely to have money and valuables? My point exactly. A rouge staff member at the West End Studios could have a heyday!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend stay in NYC through Orbitz at the West End Studio based on the beautiful pictures they have on their web site. What I encountered when we got there was a complete nightmare. The clerk gave us a room on the 6th floor and told us that the elevator was broken, but the repairman was on his way to fix it. Since coming home and reading these reviews I know that was a lie and that it's an on going problem that the hotel has no intention of fixing. After climbing 6 flights of stairs I noticed that the doors on the rooms didn't hang straight. Then as I opened the door to our room we nearly passed out from the stench. The sight that greeted us was of unmade beds with dirty sheets and blankets with nasty, dirty, towels laying everywhere. There were two department store shopping bags full of trash from the previous guest. What looked like pubic hairs were on the bedsheets. Black and white TV, no phone, broken air conditioner, and no working clock. I called Orbitz to complain and was told I could get another hotel on Time Square for a litte more money and when I agreed to take the room at the other hotel I was disconnected. I then called Orbitz back and got another operator who told me that the hotel I was told about did not exist. Yet Orbitz advertises that exact hotel on their website and we passed by it several times while at Time Square. Something is not right with this hotel being in business and Orbitz protecting the hotels business. I would not recommend anyone booking through Orbitz and advise staying as far away from West End Studios as possible. Spend the extra money and get a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever in U.S. I have been in.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just been back from NYC, and I can not forget last night on this west end studios. I have been traveling to different places in U.S. And this hotel (should I call it a hotel?) is definitely the worst one I have ever seen before. Yes, the only good thing about this hotel is its location, nothing else. 1. The condition of the room is very bad. The room is very small (a bed takes 80% of the space). TV with limited channels without a remote controller. 2. What I reservered two twin beds room. The front desk guy gave me a room with only 1 fullsize bed. Then I went to complain. He gave me another room. ----! It's still with only one bed. 3. Then I planned to accept this. However, I found that the only blanket is very thin. Then I go downstair again to ask for an extra one. That guy asked me three times very impolite: Are you cold?? Then I told him yes. Then he went to the second floor found a blanket for me. I though he should send the blanket to my room. But he stared at me, and ask me do it myself. And then we went to the elevator, he push the button to put himself to the first floor first, and leave me in the elevator. (I need to go to 4th floor). 4. All right. The worst thing is that in the mid of the night. The heat stopped!!! And it's quite a cold day! In the morning, in the bath room (several rooms share one bath room), there was no hot water at all. 5. When I checked out, I tried to complain about the heat thing. The same guy just did not listen to me. And said that I want to make him difficulty. From 2 - 5, he nevers said "sorry". The worst service ever!!! I would say that never go to this place. It would even better to stay in the subway for a night, at least you got what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for few days me and my family, I really liked The palce I was really suprised when i saw all this reviews in Trip Advisor, we got what we paid for.
